intro: Erigeron flaccidus, commonly known as the flaccid fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies. It has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron flaccidus is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
